title: 300 Ping increase in games randomly
body:
Hey there,
Within the past 2 or 3 days I have been randomly getting games where I have 275 - 300 ping games. 
Nothing has been changed in my setup, this occurs through both wired when no one is on the internet and wireless. 
My current computer I use is a Macbook pro 2014 running OS X 10.10.3 and my ISP is TPG within SA. 
Now If I get a game where it's at 45-50 ping it'll stay like that throughout the game and if I get a 275-300 ping it'll stay at 300 and it seems that the later is becoming increasingly more common. 
I've found that once the game is over I need to relog in order to get the ping back to 50 (however I still need to play the whole game with 300ping there is no fix I have found) within custom games, but it doesn't alway work.
Also when I have the 300 ping games I can ping google at 8.8.8.8 and it'll come up with 45 ping and the same thing when I run a speed test I get 40 - 50.
Any help would be appreciated, 
Cheers
Jake

replies.body:
Thanks for the updates guys.  I'm going to take a look into this from our end, to see if there is anything we can do, but I'd definitely suggest getting in touch with TPG yourselves to see if there is anything funny going on with their network.

I was also able to find a discussion [on whirlpool](http://forums.whirlpool.net.au/forum-replies.cfm?t=2434627) with TPG users talking about similar symptoms for many other online services.

Cheers
Mindstar

everyone in my game said they were having ping issues too

and i'm with iinet btw

Hi,

I've been having this exact same issue, also with TPG and residing in ADL. One theory reading on the forums is that the new windows 10 updates is overloading servers and causing high ping at primetime hours. For some reason the connection is going from Sydney back to Adelaide not the other way round causing the ping. 

Anyone having an issue, please post on the TPG forums. Im not sure whether i am allowed to link the thread that has been started?

Cheers
